_header: Saint Frideswitha was here of England
Subjects: saints’ lives; Frideswitha, saint, life of
_description:
The longer version of the Life of Saint Frideswide, 188 lines, based on the Latin Life of St. Frideswide, BHL (1898)
XBHL, . Bibliotheca hagiographica latina antiquae et mediae aetatis, ed. Sociátá des Bollandistes. 2 vols. Brussels, 1898-1901 3162 attributed to Robert of Cricklade, found in some copies of the South English Legendary — couplets. For the "short version," see 4598.5.

Bod779.First Lines:
seint friswide þe mayde was her of ingelondat oxinforde
                    ȝhe was I bore as ich ondirstond…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& þer haþ be for here loue ofte gret
                    bootnyngnowȝ bid we god for here loue to þe ioyȝe of heuin
                    vs bring

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEynte ffredeswide was her of engelondeAt oxenford heo was ibore as
                    ic vnderstonde…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…þer haþ ibe uor hire loue ofte gret bonyngeNou
                    bidde we god uor hire loue þat he to heuene ous bringe
BodAsh43.Editions:
Reames,  Sherry L.,
                        ed.  
             Middle English Legends
                of Women Saints.
         With the assistance of Martha G. Blalock and Wendy R. Larson.
            Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2003.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint ffrydeswyde was her of EngelondeAt oxenford ȝeo was
                    ybore as ich vnderstonde…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þer haþ ybeo ffor hure loue ofte gret botnyngeNow
                    bidde we god ffor hure loue þat ȝeo vs to heuene bringe

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint freþeswyde þat holy mayde was of englondeatte
                    oxenford heo was y bore as ic vnderstonde…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…heo wend out of þis world a morwe vp lukes daynow god
                    ous bringe to þe blysse þat he broȝt þat may

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint frideswithe was here of englondeat oxenforde heo was ibore as ich vnderstonde…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þer haþ we for hire loue ofte gret botnyngnou bidde we god for hire loue to þe ioie of heuen ous bringe
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xCix” added to left margin by a later hand (f. 273v).
